raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "This mass will most likely decrease in size or disappear over time", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This adolescent female presents with a classic history and exam for a fibroadenoma: a mobile, well-circumscribed, tender mass that fluctuates with the menstrual cycle. Fibroadenomas are benign breast tumors common in young women and often regress spontaneously or decrease in size over time, especially after adolescence. There is no evidence that fibroadenomas increase breast cancer risk, require radiation/chemotherapy, or that oral contraceptives will shrink them.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
